projects.name: nVentory
projects.description: Description: Fullstack PERN application utilizing microservices to handle front and back ends separately through an API/Mobile first design.

info.inspiration: This application was thought of while working at a Shopify-based brick and mortar wine store which. The slow and sometimes distracted process of organizing the space available inspired AJ to build a cleaner and easier system for tracking inventory.
implementation: A visual bridge that allows the user to break their inventory up into personalized sections and subsections, allowing for a more manageable and streamlined inventory process and interaction.
Allows shopify to stay on the computer/POS while you manage your inventory as it sits in your physical store via phone, tablet, or laptop.
info.lessons: A great experience with a strong team of 4(total) with a little under 2 weeks of class time, in our first collaborative effort/ full stack application. Throughout the project we implemented  AGILE/Scrum methodologies while holding true to our established MVP and adding possible  features in the allotted time. The main focus of our MVP was to ensure we were covering all the C.R.U.D. functionalities; rendering it fullstack, while still displaying some of the other intended features and functionalities of the user experience.
